sub_topic: The construction of the Sierpinski sieve.
message_1: How many closed triangles will there be after the 8th iteration of constructing the Sierpinski triangle using the sieve method?
message_2:
The Sierpinski triangle is a fractal that is formed by iteratively removing triangles from an initial equilateral triangle. In the sieve method, at each iteration, we remove the middle triangle of each remaining triangle, effectively dividing each triangle into 3 smaller triangles.

The number of closed triangles (triangles that are not removed) after the nth iteration can be calculated using the formula:

Closed triangles = (3^n - 1) / 2

For the 8th iteration:

Closed triangles = (3^8 - 1) / 2
Closed triangles = (6561 - 1) / 2
Closed triangles = 6560 / 2
Closed triangles = 3280

So, after the 8th iteration of constructing the Sierpinski triangle using the sieve method, there will be 3280 closed triangles.
